job_title: IT Business Analyst Team Leader - PA14850122
job_text: ['', 'Minimum 5 years experience as a Business Analyst and manager of staff. ', 'Basic understanding of relational database concepts and ability to construct basic Microsoft SQL queries a plus. ', 'Gathers and documents business functional requirements, conducts research, meets with users and stakeholders, crates wireframe mock ups and process flow diagrams. ', 'Must be able to communicate effectively and be able to work with a diverse population of stakeholders and team members. ', 'Able to effectively adapt to rapidly changing project requirements and business priorities.Training Requirements Must complete I', 'Proven ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously. ', 'Collaborate with and support developers during their design and development efforts to assist with their analysis of the requirements and/or user stories ', 'Ensures that the Business Analyst process is effectively supporting the business in the successful delivery of projects.Reports status and problems to appropriate IT management and/or Project Management teams. Communicates with Vertical Screen Executives, Operations team, Developers and Clients as required to support the delivery of projects. Supports the ITQA team, BA Team and PMs through communication with stakeholders to resolve issues as required. ', 'Upholds all corporate security policies and procedures.Ensures that daily activities support safeguarding of client and corporate data and resources.Reports any security concerns to the security team.Required Skills and Experience ', 'Coordinates Grooming Sessions and participates in Sprint Planning, Sprint Reviews, Scrum Meetings, functional testing and other Agile/Scrum ceremonies and activities, as required.This role will interact with product / business owners, business users, scrum master, developers, ITQA and PMs. ', 'Business Analysis experience with writing requirements for web application development. ', 'Proficient in translating the business requirements into technology solutions to deliver business value and user satisfaction. ', 'Documented working experience with Microsoft Windows environments and the Microsoft Office suite.Experience with Atlassian JIRA and Confluence strongly preferred. ', 'Exceptional written and oral communication, meeting facilitation critical thinking and problem solving skills.Demonstrated planning, organizing, decision-making, influencing, delegation, team work, negotiation, and conflict management capabilities. ', 'Strong understanding of the role of Business Analysts and their respective best practices in the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Agile/Scrum methodology. Experience with both waterfall and agile development methodologies preferred. Strong interpersonal, communication and relational skills, strong organizational and project management skills. Agile Certification required. ', 'Writes requirements and/or user stories ensuring to include validation criteria which reasonably cover all areas necessary for development and complete testing of the new functionality ', 'Manages the IT BA team.Trains, develops, and appraises IT BA staff effectively. ']

['Education and Experience:', 'Change Management', 'Extracts data from ERP systems for use in analytics, business intelligence tools, and reporting. job_title: Technical Business Analyst / Title Insurance & Real Estate Industries (REMOTE)
job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities', 'BS in Management Information Systems or similar degree preferred, but not required depending on equivalent experience.', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills.', 'Coordinate and participate in front-end testing when required and the testing of custom configurations', 'Proficient in problem solving, interviewing, and fact finding.', 'Technical Business Analyst / Title Insurance & Real Estate Industries (REMOTE)', 'Work with the Project management team to create documentation that describes the solution: design, use cases, screen shots, etc.', 'Act as Subject Matter Expert for our client’s applications to conduct live customer training sessions and provide internal knowledge transfer and support', 'Gather, understand and document both functional and business requirements', 'Minimum five years’ experience as a technical Business Analyst.', ' Work with the business to document, clarify, and suggest improvements to the applications used Elicit, evaluate, and document requirements from the customers Work with the technical team to determine appropriate/optimal solutions Work with the Project management team to create documentation that describes the solution: design, use cases, screen shots, etc. Work collaboratively with clients, the implementation team, Product Managers and the Development team Gather, understand and document both functional and business requirements Create detailed functional specifications, user stories, acceptance criteria for product and process enhancements Clearly communicate development objectives, needs and status of projects to internal stakeholders Coordinate and participate in front-end testing when required and the testing of custom configurations Act as Subject Matter Expert for our client’s applications to conduct live customer training sessions and provide internal knowledge transfer and support ', 'Elicit, evaluate, and document requirements from the customers', 'Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change.', 'Demonstrate expertise in: MS Office products (Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), Various Development Methodologies (waterfall, agile), various application testing methodologies.', ' Proficient in problem solving, interviewing, and fact finding. Minimum five years’ experience as a technical Business Analyst. Demonstrated ability to exercise good judgment, prioritize multiple tasks, and problem solve under pressure of deadlines and resource constraints. Able to diagnose, escalate, and solve issues and risks. Experience and understanding of title insurance policy processing solutions Experience with user story and issue tracking solutions (Azure DevOps, JIRA, etc.) Self-starter who seeks new challenges and responsibilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Work well independently and with a team. Identify opportunities for improvement and make constructive suggestions for change. Working knowledge of basic software architectures, basic network/infrastructure architectures. Become an expert on processes and systems to find improvements and perform root cause analysis.', ' Serve as Project Manager, Business Analyst, and potentially Scrum Master for the a java software development team comprised of 2 Java Developers, 1 Technical Lead / Senior Developer, and 1 Quality Assurance Engineer. Developing project plans and charters for application development projects to support our pension administration system.', ' Minimum 5 year project management experience', ' Serve as Project Manager, Business Analyst, and potentially Scrum Master for the a java software development team comprised of 2 Java Developers, 1 Technical Lead / Senior Developer, and 1 Quality Assurance Engineer. Developing project plans and charters for application development projects to support our pension administration system. Manage and lead development teams to successful outcomes: identify key metrics, set milestones and timelines, assess performance, develop communication materials and allocate resources. Ensure team members are inserting their time and tasks accurately in JIRA. As PM set the tone for the team to build an effective and happy team. Create project plans and resource assignments in the Celoxis project management tool. Illicit and document requirements and acceptance criteria from users using various methods. Perform analysis to understand the inner workings of all assigned tasks and projects. Become an expert on processes and systems to find improvements and perform root cause analysis. Create user stories that meet the definition of ready and ensure development of these stories meets the definition of done. Ensure team meets the definition of done for all stories and definition of releasable for all releases. Create project vision documents to define the project with the help of SME’s, product owners and technical experts. Present the vision to the senior management team. Perform role of scrum master, ensure the team feels comfortable sharing positive and negative feelings during retrospectives. Facilitate the sprint review. Work with PO’s on grooming the backlog and remove roadblocks quickly. Participate in story estimating, ensure team creates proper subtasks and tracks their time in Jira. Present project status to senior management team. Ensure software development projects have adequate automated test coverage. Manage UAT and UXT for users.', 'Job Description', ' Create project vision documents to define the project with the help of SME’s, product owners and technical experts. Present the vision to the senior management team.', 'Knowledge, Skills & Abilities', 'Requirements', ' Experience in the Financial/Retirement sector, including administration of health insurance and benefit payments, is a plus']

job_title: Sr. Business Analyst, Magellan Business Transformation - Commercial Analytics
job_text: ['', ' Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting. ', ' High sense of urgency and commitment to execution. ', ' Life-Work Integration ', ' Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash. ', '  Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting.   Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Science or supply chain related field required.   Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required.   Experience in BSC Sales Operations, Marketing, IT or related commercial functions with a focus on Sales Analytics and Reporting   Strong experience in working on Data modelling tools, BI and Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Alteryx etc.)   Previous experience of a major program introduction/upgrade, ideally within an IT/Systems or Business Representative role.   Working knowledge of ERP systems and the broader Application Ecosystem and Interfaces, combined with knowledge of key business processes.   A proven track record of Continuous Improvement, system upgrades/enhancements, proactive problem solving or LBP.   Ability to establish, communicate and engage teams in the vision & strategy of the Magellan Program.   Create a sense of energy, excitement, and personal commitment to the organization by empowering others, rewarding and celebrating superior performance, and creating an inclusive workplace across eight locations   Demonstrated capability in collaborating and influencing across an organization   Good listening and communication skills, with ability to transfer knowledge efficiently.   Demonstrated high degree of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to establish credibility   High sense of urgency and commitment to execution.   Role location is flexible, with participation at Team meetings, collaborative project events, with a Marlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations.  ', ' Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential ', 'Requisition ID: ', 'About The Role', ' Role location is flexible, with participation at Team meetings, collaborative project events, with a Marlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations. ', ' Strong experience in working on Data modelling tools, BI and Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Alteryx etc.) ', ' Working knowledge of ERP systems and the broader Application Ecosystem and Interfaces, combined with knowledge of key business processes. ', ' Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required. ', 'Additional Locations:', '  Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.)   Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements   Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria.   Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash.   Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base   Collaborate with the Magellan Outbound Workstream and the extended Magellan program (Program Management, IT Solution Architects, SAP COE and Magellan Functional Workstreams) in a Scalable Agile Framework/DevOps methodology, to enable rapid deployment.   Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential  ', ' Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements ', ' Good listening and communication skills, with ability to transfer knowledge efficiently. ', ' arlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations. ', ' Create a sense of energy, excitement, and personal commitment to the organization by empowering others, rewarding and celebrating superior performance, and creating an inclusive workplace across eight locations ', ' Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria. ', ' Experience in BSC Sales Operations, Marketing, IT or related commercial functions with a focus on Sales Analytics and Reporting ', ' Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base ', 'About Us', ' Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.) ', ' Community ', 'Your Responsibilities Will Include', ' Career GrowthAt Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.About The RoleThe Business Analyst, Business Transformation reporting to the Manager, Business Transformation--Sales Operations is part of the Sales Enablement organization with responsibility to Magellan program. The Sales Enablement organization’s mission is to leverage operational excellence across Boston Scientific divisions and geographies and assist in the strategic deployment of transformational technology.The Business Analyst role will be a member of a dynamic team contributing to cross-divisional commercial analytics and business intelligence solutions. Foundational to the role will be design, configuration and integration of analytics with the next generation BSC ERP (SAP S/4). The role and team will also work to extend the capabilities of purpose-built analytics solutions.As a member of the team, you will participate in projects following Scaled Agile project Framework. In addition, the Business Analyst represents the Business Users, collaborating with the Magellan and Sales Enablement workstreams, Strategic Integration vendors, BSC Business Process Leads, Subject Matter Experts, Communities of Practice and other Stakeholders across the BSC organization.Your Responsibilities Will Include  Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.)   Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements   Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria.   Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash.   Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base   Collaborate with the Magellan Outbound Workstream and the extended Magellan program (Program Management, IT Solution Architects, SAP COE and Magellan Functional Workstreams) in a Scalable Agile Framework/DevOps methodology, to enable rapid deployment.   Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential  What We’re Looking For  Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting.   Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Science or supply chain related field required.   Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required. job_title: Sr. Business Analyst, Magellan Business Transformation - Commercial Analytics
job_text: ['', ' Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting. ', ' High sense of urgency and commitment to execution. ', ' Life-Work Integration ', ' Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash. ', '  Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting.   Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Science or supply chain related field required.   Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required.   Experience in BSC Sales Operations, Marketing, IT or related commercial functions with a focus on Sales Analytics and Reporting   Strong experience in working on Data modelling tools, BI and Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Alteryx etc.)   Previous experience of a major program introduction/upgrade, ideally within an IT/Systems or Business Representative role.   Working knowledge of ERP systems and the broader Application Ecosystem and Interfaces, combined with knowledge of key business processes.   A proven track record of Continuous Improvement, system upgrades/enhancements, proactive problem solving or LBP.   Ability to establish, communicate and engage teams in the vision & strategy of the Magellan Program.   Create a sense of energy, excitement, and personal commitment to the organization by empowering others, rewarding and celebrating superior performance, and creating an inclusive workplace across eight locations   Demonstrated capability in collaborating and influencing across an organization   Good listening and communication skills, with ability to transfer knowledge efficiently.   Demonstrated high degree of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to establish credibility   High sense of urgency and commitment to execution. ', ' Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential ', 'Requisition ID: ', 'About The Role', ' Role location is flexible, with participation at Team meetings, collaborative project events, with a Marlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations. ', ' Strong experience in working on Data modelling tools, BI and Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Alteryx etc.) ', ' Working knowledge of ERP systems and the broader Application Ecosystem and Interfaces, combined with knowledge of key business processes. ', ' Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required. ', 'Additional Locations:', '  Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.)   Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements   Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria.   Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash.   Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base   Collaborate with the Magellan Outbound Workstream and the extended Magellan program (Program Management, IT Solution Architects, SAP COE and Magellan Functional Workstreams) in a Scalable Agile Framework/DevOps methodology, to enable rapid deployment.   Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential  ', ' Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements ', ' Good listening and communication skills, with ability to transfer knowledge efficiently. ', ' arlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations. ', ' Create a sense of energy, excitement, and personal commitment to the organization by empowering others, rewarding and celebrating superior performance, and creating an inclusive workplace across eight locations ', ' Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria. ', ' Experience in BSC Sales Operations, Marketing, IT or related commercial functions with a focus on Sales Analytics and Reporting ', ' Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base ', 'About Us', ' Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.) ', ' Community ', 'Your Responsibilities Will Include', ' Career GrowthAt Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.About The RoleThe Business Analyst, Business Transformation reporting to the Manager, Business Transformation--Sales Operations is part of the Sales Enablement organization with responsibility to Magellan program. The Sales Enablement organization’s mission is to leverage operational excellence across Boston Scientific divisions and geographies and assist in the strategic deployment of transformational technology.The Business Analyst role will be a member of a dynamic team contributing to cross-divisional commercial analytics and business intelligence solutions. Foundational to the role will be design, configuration and integration of analytics with the next generation BSC ERP (SAP S/4). The role and team will also work to extend the capabilities of purpose-built analytics solutions.As a member of the team, you will participate in projects following Scaled Agile project Framework. In addition, the Business Analyst represents the Business Users, collaborating with the Magellan and Sales Enablement workstreams, Strategic Integration vendors, BSC Business Process Leads, Subject Matter Experts, Communities of Practice and other Stakeholders across the BSC organization.Your Responsibilities Will Include  Help drive the data and reporting vision and strategy for BSC Commercial and Sales Operation teams while building towards future state capabilities (Predictive Analytics/AI/RPA etc.)   Represent the business users and stakeholders to define User Requirements   Translate User Requirements into User Stories that include the ‘Who, What, Why’ for Acceptance Criteria.   Coordinate with the other project workstreams, Strategic Integration Vendors, BSC BPL’s, SME’s, Communities of Practice’s, IT Solution Architects/COE and Stakeholders across the network to develop a strong and deep pool of expertise across Outbound Order to Cash.   Collaborate with the Training team and Site Super Users/BPLs/SMEs to develop training plans for each of the key Applications to enhance the knowledge base   Collaborate with the Magellan Outbound Workstream and the extended Magellan program (Program Management, IT Solution Architects, SAP COE and Magellan Functional Workstreams) in a Scalable Agile Framework/DevOps methodology, to enable rapid deployment.   Support a dynamic team that encourages constructive feedback and open dialogue contributing to team members achieving full potential  What We’re Looking For  Experience in BSC Sales Analytics and Reporting.   Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, Science or supply chain related field required.   Technical professional or operational Analytics/Business Intelligence experience in medical device field required.   Experience in BSC Sales Operations, Marketing, IT or related commercial functions with a focus on Sales Analytics and Reporting   Strong experience in working on Data modelling tools, BI and Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI, Alteryx etc.)   Previous experience of a major program introduction/upgrade, ideally within an IT/Systems or Business Representative role.   Working knowledge of ERP systems and the broader Application Ecosystem and Interfaces, combined with knowledge of key business processes.   A proven track record of Continuous Improvement, system upgrades/enhancements, proactive problem solving or LBP.   Ability to establish, communicate and engage teams in the vision & strategy of the Magellan Program.   Create a sense of energy, excitement, and personal commitment to the organization by empowering others, rewarding and celebrating superior performance, and creating an inclusive workplace across eight locations   Demonstrated capability in collaborating and influencing across an organization   Good listening and communication skills, with ability to transfer knowledge efficiently.   Demonstrated high degree of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to establish credibility   High sense of urgency and commitment to execution.   Role location is flexible, with participation at Team meetings, collaborative project events, with a Marlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations.    arlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.Boston Scientific is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Disability, VeteranRequisition ID: 475233', ' Demonstrated high degree of integrity, professionalism, and the ability to establish credibility ', ' Collaborate with the Magellan Outbound Workstream and the extended Magellan program (Program Management, IT Solution Architects, SAP COE and Magellan Functional Workstreams) in a Scalable Agile Framework/DevOps methodology, to enable rapid deployment. ', '  arlborough/Minnesota focus and across Outbound Order to Cash locations.  ', ' A proven track record of Continuous Improvement, system upgrades/enhancements, proactive problem solving or LBP. Senior ERP Business Analyst & Project Manager
job_text: ['', '2.\tWhat matters most to you in your next role?', '5 years leading and managing complex tier 1 and/or 2 enterprise solution projects and teams.5 years facilitating business process analysis and design with client teams.2 years of managing a client relationship or executive leadership team communication, including presenting formal recommendations.Broad business background, with depth in one or more functions (including finance/accounting, manufacturing and/or operations).', 'Preferred Education and Certifications', 'Project Management.', 'Please apply, as described above.', 'Position Summary:', 'Team Leadership.\xa0The SBA will mentor and help build an internal bench of business analysts and project managers, leveraging our Methodology, Approach and Toolset (MAT).', 'PgMP, PMP and/or PBA Certification from Project Management Institute (PMI)', 'Work Environment', 'o\xa0\xa0Use excellent communication skills, treating everyone with dignity and respect. Explain complex information clearly and simply.', 'o\xa0\xa0Help our Clients document their as-is and future state requirements.', ':', '5 years leading and managing complex tier 1 and/or 2 enterprise solution projects and teams.', "o\xa0\xa0Executive presence. Project confidence and gravitas (substance) under pressure, present effectively, and can 'read the room', so that they can influence an audience.", 'Physical Demands', '5 years facilitating business process analysis and design with client teams.', 'Critical thinking skills are needed to analyze, think objectively, and come up with solutions.', 'Broad business background, with depth in one or more functions (including finance/accounting, manufacturing and/or operations).', 'In your cover letter, in addition to your normal cover letter information, please include:\xa0', 'Team Leadership.', 'o\xa0\xa0Create RFI’s/RFP’s to send to potential solution vendors.', 'Skills:', 'o\xa0\xa0Ensure that team members and stakeholders understand their roles in the project and can perform tasks effectively and to the standards of Syte and the client.', '2 years of managing a client relationship or executive leadership team communication, including presenting formal recommendations.', 'Leadership skills are needed to motivate and lead others strategically and operationally.', 'Syte Consulting Group is growing (growth opportunities!) and is seeking qualified applicants for this primarily remote position, typically working with clients in the Pacific to Central time zones. We are committed to excellence in our teamwork and results, internal and externally. Our projects are typically centered around software selection and implementations.\xa0\xa0This position is open until filled.', 'o\xa0\xa0Identify and vet suitable vendors.', 'Communicate with dignity and respect at all levels, being sensitive to the needs and style of others. Use well-developed verbal and written skills for recommendations, presentations, documentation, continuous improvement, teamwork, etc.', 'Experience:', 'Position', 'Vendor and Partner Relationship Management.\xa0The SBA will serve as our point person to identify, assess, select, on-board, and sustain relationships with high-quality vendors and partners.', '\xa0', 'o\xa0\xa0Review and evaluate vendor responses to RFPs.', 'Software skills: ERP, MS Outlook, Citrix Sharefile, OneNote, SmartSheet, Excel. PowerPoint, LucidChart, etc.Communicate with dignity and respect at all levels, being sensitive to the needs and style of others. Use well-developed verbal and written skills for recommendations, presentations, documentation, continuous improvement, teamwork, etc.Critical thinking skills are needed to analyze, think objectively, and come up with solutions.Project management skills to successfully organize and manage projects to completion.Leadership skills are needed to motivate and lead others strategically and operationally.Strong teamwork skills with to work with other IT professionals, client staff, and executive team members to ensure cooperative and successful relationships and projects.', 'This position includes the operation of typical office tools, such as the computer keyboard, computer mouse or other tracking device, telephone, video, and web conferencing. This position may require working stationary at a computer for long stretches at a time. The person in this position frequently communicates via in-person, telephone, video, email and/or in documents and must be able to communicate effectively. Travel to the Client’s place of business may be required and will usually be scheduled with at least two weeks’ notice, although travel without as much notice may occur on an infrequent basis.', 'Vendor and Partner Relationship Management.', 'o\xa0\xa0Lead Successful Software Selection Projects\xa0', 'o\xa0\xa0Recommend solutions and implementation strategies that are appropriate and transformational relative to each client’s mission, vision, culture, and strategy.\xa0', 'o\xa0\xa0Design, plan, lead and manage Business Solution Selection Projects.', '3.\tWhat is important to you about the company you work for?\xa0', 'Skills', 'o\xa0\xa0Continuously develop the relationship, provide guidance, advice, and ensure the client’s needs are being met.', 'o\xa0\xa0Arrange for client-facing solution demonstrations.', 'The Sr ERP Business Analyst & Project Manager (SBA) will use Syte’s Methodology, Approach and Toolset (MAT) to manage and deliver successful ERP Solution Selection Projects (SSP) for our clients.\xa0As you manage the process, you will look for opportunities to increase sales, strengthen processes, and improve efficiency for the Client and Syte CG. The SBA will serve as Syte’s point person to build and sustain relationships with clients, vendors, and partners, as they design, plan, lead, and manage Solution Selection Projects (SSP).', 'Software skills: ERP, MS Outlook, Citrix Sharefile, OneNote, SmartSheet, Excel. PowerPoint, LucidChart, etc.', 'Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or any related field from an accredited institution.', 'o\xa0\xa0Plan and manage the execution of multiple projects from start to finish, leading the project team, creating a budget and detailed timeline with deliverables and activities for project completion, and ensure that the project is progressing accordingly.', 'o\xa0\xa0Help Clients to methodically review, assess, evaluate, and select optimal solutions and vendors.', 'o\xa0\xa0Respond to client needs, documenting, communicating, and adjusting the project plan accordingly.', 'o\xa0\xa0Establish and communicate the cadence and content for regular progress updates with clients and stakeholders.', 'Client Relationship Management.', 'PgMP, PMP and/or PBA Certification from Project Management Institute (PMI)Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or any related field from an accredited institution.', 'Strong teamwork skills with to work with other IT professionals, client staff, and executive team members to ensure cooperative and successful relationships and projects.', 'Position:\xa0\xa0Remote Employee, Full-time, Exempt level, reporting to the CEO', 'Work is typically done work in an office environment and may occasionally need to be performed at the project’s physical worksite. Sitting or standing at a computer station, keyboarding, using project management software, and placing calls or attending video meetings. The work is a regular full-time schedule, with the need to work additional or irregular hours depending on project deadlines.', '4.\tWhat is important to you about the people you work with?\xa0', 'Project management skills to successfully organize and manage projects to completion.', 'Preferred Education and Certifications:', 'Position Summary', 'Position Essential Functions:', '1.\tPay expectations']

['With a large and growing accounting and finance team, there is significant opportunity for growth and advancement within the organization.\xa0They truly believe in promoting from within! The company boasts a team-oriented culture, excellent benefits, awesome on-site amenities, and strong work/life balance.\xa0The company prides itself on providing its’ employees with the tools and training necessary to succeed.', 'Responsibilities:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Serve as business partner to support new lease contracts and lease renewals or other modifications.', 'The Senior Analyst Accountant will be primarily responsible for managing the accounting for the company’s North American lease portfolio and assist with global lease accounting reporting as needed. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Month end close activities related to lease accounting including tracking and reconciling contractual lease obligations to actual monthly lease payments, recording monthly lease journal entries, and maintaining lease contract repository and sub ledger detail.', 'Senior Analyst Accountant ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0The Senior Analyst Accountant will assist with other duties and ad hoc reporting as needed.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Assist international subsidiaries with local statutory reporting requirements related to leases and guidance on lease accounting policy.', 'Senior Analyst Accountant (33691)', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels of the organization.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Support recent acquisition lease accounting and reporting.', '\xa0', 'Senior Analyst Accountant', 'Newly created position! Our client is a leading global organization that is looking for a Senior Analyst Accountant to join their team.\xa0This company is a highly desired place to work! This is a very visible role within the organization and the ideal candidate will have the opportunity to be involved in a number of corporate projects. They are looking for someone with strong overall accounting experience coming from a corporate environment.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0CPA and/or CPA certification eligible preferred.', 'The Senior Analyst Accountant will possess the following:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office products, specifically Excel.', 'Equal Opportunity Employer', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Prepare consolidated lease disclosures for annual financial statements and related audit support.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0The Senior Analyst Accountant will have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0The Senior Analyst Accountant will have 4+ years’ general accounting experience. Technical accounting experience a plus.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Develop and implement policies and procedures with emphasis on internal controls.', 'Requirements', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0The Senior Analyst Accountant will record and analyze the company’s financial information and ensure it’s done in a timely manner.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Strong knowledge of US GAAP.']

['', ' Military Health Systems(MHS) Data Analyst', 'Ensure data integrity is maintained by completing routine data quality analysis.', 'Provide overall data management and analytic solutions, ensuring adherence to all applicable privacy, data security, and data integrity regulations and guidelines to include Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and Human Subject Research.', 'Generate and manage files for research study data.', 'Experience working within VHA and Veteran Benefits Administration (VBA) with an understanding of VA business processes. (Preferred but not mandatory)', 'Knowesis - Interesting Work with Interesting People', 'Preferred Skills & Qualifications:', 'Security Clearance: ', 'Support Department of Defense (DoD) and Veterans Affairs (VA) internal and external research partnerships in the hearing health community as well as general analyses required within the HCE.Provide overall data management and analytic solutions, ensuring adherence to all applicable privacy, data security, and data integrity regulations and guidelines to include Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and Human Subject Research.Serve as a Subject Matter Expert of acoustic data and make recommendations on improving data collection methodologies related to any hearing requirements.Generate and manage files for research study data.Extract data from multiple data warehousing sources to generate and design standard and ad-hoc reports.Ensure data integrity is maintained by completing routine data quality analysis.De-identification of clinical and audiogram datasets.Assist with data sharing agreements and protocol development.', 'Experience working with Defense Occupational & Environment Health Readiness System-Hearing Conservation (DOEHRS-HC), Enterprise Clinical Audiology Application (ECAA), Theater Medical Data Store (TMDS), and Department of Defense Trauma Registry (DoDTR). (Preferred but not mandatory)', 'Duties And Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To', 'De-identification of clinical and audiogram datasets.', 'Experience with Veteran Health Administration (VHA) data systems to include but not limited to: Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW), DoD and VA Infrastructure for Clinical Intelligence (DaVINCI), Decision Support System (DSS), VistA, and Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS). (Preferred but not mandatory)', 'Education:', 'Assist with data sharing agreements and protocol development.', 'Experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Qlik, SAS, or Power BI, for report/dashboard development.', 'Experience with ETL Tools and programming languages such as T-SQL, PL/SQL, Informatica, or SSIS.', 'Extensive experience working with Military Health Systems (MHS) data systems, such as Management Analysis and Reporting Tool (M2)/MHS Data Repository (MDR), Defense Manpower Data Center (DMDC)/Defense Eligibility and Enrollment Systems (DEERS).', 'Extract data from multiple data warehousing sources to generate and design standard and ad-hoc reports.', 'Required Experience', 'Serve as a Subject Matter Expert of acoustic data and make recommendations on improving data collection methodologies related to any hearing requirements.', 'Extensive experience working with Military Health Systems (MHS) data systems, such as Management Analysis and Reporting Tool (M2)/MHS Data Repository (MDR), Defense Manpower Data Center (DMDC)/Defense Eligibility and Enrollment Systems (DEERS).Experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools such as Tableau, Qlik, SAS, or Power BI, for report/dashboard development.Experience with ETL Tools and programming languages such as T-SQL, PL/SQL, Informatica, or SSIS.Experience working with Defense Occupational & Environment Health Readiness System-Hearing Conservation (DOEHRS-HC), Enterprise Clinical Audiology Application (ECAA), Theater Medical Data Store (TMDS), and Department of Defense Trauma Registry (DoDTR). (Preferred but not mandatory)Experience with Veteran Health Administration (VHA) data systems to include but not limited to: Corporate Data Warehouse (CDW), DoD and VA Infrastructure for Clinical Intelligence (DaVINCI), Decision Support System (DSS), VistA, and Computerized Patient Record System (CPRS). (Preferred but not mandatory)Experience working within VHA and Veteran Benefits Administration (VBA) with an understanding of VA business processes. If you are curious, ambitious and dedicated, you will love our\xa0community.\xa0Grow\xa0with us!', 'The day-to-day role is to work with business (Supply Chain / Operations / Quality / Finance) and IT partners on understanding the business processes and performing business analysis techniques that enable projects to be successful and goals to be met. (CSI) is devoted to developing and commercializing innovative solutions for treating peripheral and coronary vascular disease. Our primary focus is helping physicians conquer even the most difficult disease states, including arterial calcium, given the complications it presents for the millions who suffer from peripheral arterial disease (PAD) and coronary artery disease (CAD). job_title: Senior Data Analyst (Hebrew speaking and East Coast based)
job_text: ['', '➔\tStartup mentality - a must', 'About the role:', '➔\tExperience with data visualization of large data sets using BI systems (Sisense etc.)', '➔\tOwn and manage a large marketing budget, across multiple channel partnerships and multiple points of sale. Define and implement bidding strategy working closely with the Data Science and Analytics team', 'Minimum 3 years', 'c.\tOutstanding teamwork skills', '➔\tAbility to make data-driven decisions and apply them to facilitate performance optimizations', '➔\tExcellent verbal and written communication skills, with a strong ability to interact with and influence organization leadership teams', '➔\tVast knowledge and experience in performance marketing across multiple points of sale - an advantage.', "We're a hyper-growth, well-funded startup, with offices in Israel and the US, that believes in full transparency, continuous improvement, creativity, and most importantly - to enjoy what we do.", 'a.\tRoll up your sleeves attitude', '➔\tConstantly perform deep-dive analysis to discover business trends, A/B testing to optimize campaigns a', '➔\tHebrew speaker - a must', 'We love to travel as much as you do.\xa0', 'Hebrew', 'must', "We believe in making hotel stays more affordable - so that you can save your money for more unforgettable travel experiences. If you want to make an impact and give everyone the chance to experience the world - let's talk!", 'This role will report to the VP Marketing located in Israel.', 'b.\tAbility to excel in a rapidly changing environment', 'We are looking for a passionate and seasoned campaign manager which will join our team and lead our disrupting product in the B2C channel.\xa0', '➔\tBe at the forefront of our customer acquisition efforts. Determine customer metrics, identify opportunities, and lead the company to meet its performance goals.', 'About us - Splitty:', 'Splitty was founded in 2015, launched onto the market in 2019 and raised $13m so far.', '➔\tAdvance SQL and Excel knowledge and skills. Knowledge and skills in Elastic search & Kibana - an advantage.', '\ufeff', '➔\tWork collaboratively to support multiple stakeholders in the company - provide suggestions and recommendations to different managers and teams during the decision-making process', 'We are an equal employment opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected classification under federal and state law.', 'Sr. Data Analyst, Hebrew speaking and East Coast based', 'Desired Skills and experience:', 'Splitty is an innovative award-winning startup, aiming to be the next worldwide travel brand. We offer unique hotel prices by splitting and combining multiple bookings under one reservation.', '➔\tMinimum 3 years of experience with data analysis at Travel, eCommerce, or Consumer Product company - a must', 'This position does not include a relocation package', "That's why we want to make it attainable, so you can make your travel dreams a reality."]

", 'Participate in implementation of object oriented designs using C++ programming language. ', 'Use scripting languages to generate model behaviors not inherent in base framework design. ', 'At MEIT YOU WILL have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest, most experienced engineering and technology experts in the U.S.!!', 'Location', 'Why Choose MEIT??', 'MEIT reputation for entering a new market, getting to work and generating immediate and impactful results.', 'Sr. ', 'Join our team TODAY! ', 'Relocation Assistance', 'Contact', 'Participate in all phases of advanced concept development to include data gathering and coordination, model development and analysis of simulation results. ', 'Possess strong problem solving, analytical and debugging skills.', "Demonstrated experience (5-10 years' minimum) in modeling and simulation and war gaming participation", 'Conduct modeling and simulation activities in support of research studies focused on directed energy weapon systems. ', 'Experience with modeling and simulation tools such as Matlab, Simulink, AFSIM or EADSIM is a plusBasic understanding of and experience with directed energyExperience with distributed mission operations (DMO)Knowledge of object oriented programmingTS/SCI eligibility is highly desired', 'MEIT stands by delivering what we promise with flexibility, quality and integrity to our employees and our customers. ', 'DoD SECRET or equivalent security clearance at a minimum.', 'TS/SCI eligibility is highly desired', 'Job Title', 'Perform unit and system testing to ensure reliability of system models.', 'Build simulation frameworks and ensure the simulation interfaces appropriately with other tools in a distributed environment. ', 'Basic understanding of and experience with directed energyExperience with distributed mission operations (DMO)', 'YOU WILL ', 'Conduct modeling and simulation activities in support of research studies focused on directed energy weapon systems.  Apply an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to plan, design, develop and verify directed energy, sensors and other combat systems through engineering/physics based models. Participate in all phases of advanced concept development to include data gathering and coordination, model development and analysis of simulation results. Participate in implementation of object oriented designs using C++ programming language. Use scripting languages to generate model behaviors not inherent in base framework design. Perform unit and system testing to ensure reliability of system models.Develop and present modeling and simulation implementation plans and work break down structures to stakeholders that describe how advanced concepts are represented in a virtual environment. Build simulation frameworks and ensure the simulation interfaces appropriately with other tools in a distributed environment. Model advanced military concepts, processes, and interactions with the appropriate level of fidelity; document assumptions as required. Build output files to support the study analysis plan and post process data using MATLAB or other software tools. Provide demonstrations of advanced concept system performance to stakeholders and distinguished visitors.']

job_title: Microsoft Dynamics AX Business Analyst - 120 K - Illinois
job_text: ['', 'Microsoft Dynamics and Azure', 'Duties And Responsibilities', 'Leads requirements documentation, development of testing plans and scenarios, test execution and results tracking. ['', 'REQUIRED SKILLS', 'PREFERRED', 'Relevant BA/BS degree and/or certifications (CRISC, CISSP, CCIE, CISM, CISA, CCSK)', 'Biggest growth area due to M&A: GRC Orchestration Teams - Two GRC Orchestration teams are being formed that will drive the integrated execution of GRC activities for the clouds. GRC Orchestration Team covers Salesforce Services, Salesforce Government Cloud, Enterprise, and international certifications (commercial and public sector). GRC activities performed by the GRC Orchestration teams include leading external audits, driving issue resolution, conducting Tier 2 risk assessments, being a cloud SME and providing support across all GRC activities. The GRC Orchestration teams will be the face of GRC to the clouds. These teams will operate the GRC processes designed by the GRC Integrated Process and Design teams and provide feedback to the design team about how we can continue to improve processes.', 'Experience with GRC tools (Metricstream, Archer, etc.)', 'Strong knowledge of security risk management and running audits/certification programs with frameworks including related regulatory compliance requirements (1 of the following; SOC, HITRUST, HIPAA, FedRAMP, PCI) required (internal audits is a different department/posting)', 'To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.', 'Relevant BA/BS degree and/or certifications (CRISC, CISSP, CCIE, CISM, CISA, CCSK)You have built productive relationships with Technical Operations, Security Operations, Incident Response, Technical Compliance and other stakeholders.You have relevant knowledge of network engineering, systems engineering and related device engineering if appropriate as appropriate for your focus area.Knowledge of infrastructure, network, engineer, programming is a plusPCI and SOC 1/2 are most needed frameworks.AWS CertificationsExperience with GRC tools (Metricstream, Archer, etc.)10% travel could be needed depending on role.', '7+ years experience for Sr Analyst, 9+ for the Manager experience in your relevant GRC focus area.You have experience in security risk management, controls assessment, or configuration managementStrong knowledge of security risk management and running audits/certification programs with frameworks including related regulatory compliance requirements (1 of the following; SOC, HITRUST, HIPAA, FedRAMP, PCI) required (internal audits is a different department/posting)Knowledge of, or experience working with, Cloud technologies/environments, AWS or other related cloud experience is required.', '7+ years experience for Sr Analyst, 9+ for the Manager experience in your relevant GRC focus area.', 'Salesforce.com', 'You have built productive relationships with Technical Operations, Security Operations, Incident Response, Technical Compliance and other stakeholders.', 'Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world\'s #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” five years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” eight years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. ['', ' Provide expert input to the contract QASP and its ongoing improvement over time  Lead team and provide SME input to set, verify, validate, improve work standards, standard operating positions (SOP’s) and other desktop procedures  Responsible for recognizing data problems that might invalidate samples, investigating complaints, reviewing violations found by center QA staff, and preparing reports of findings and of actions needed or taken  Identify and document defects, functional and process inconstancies  Recommend changes in SOP’s, production standards, administrative procedures, and other actions that will improve contract performance  Conduct complex quality analyses as needed to determine root cause and identify ways to improve  Lead lean six sigma process evaluations  Conduct frequent internal quality control reviews and audits ', ' Recommend changes in SOP’s, production standards, administrative procedures, and other actions that will improve contract performance ', 'Six Sigma certification is preferable, must be able to obtain a Certified Quality Improvement Associate (CQIA) certification within six months of hire into the position.', 'Clearance Requirement', 'Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent or (4) years of relevant experience', 'Proven ability to use and interpret the applicable documents as described in the NBC Statement of Work', 'Basic Qualifications For This Position Are As Follows', 'Work Environment', 'Physical Demands', ' Essential duties and responsibilities for the position include the following: ', ' Mainly office but may also include all other work environments as required. ', ' Provide expert input to the contract QASP and its ongoing improvement over time ', 'Applicant must be able to obtain and maintain a Moderate Risk Public Trust clearance (MRPT)', ' Conduct complex quality analyses as needed to determine root cause and identify ways to improve ', ' Responsible for recognizing data problems that might invalidate samples, investigating complaints, reviewing violations found by center QA staff, and preparing reports of findings and of actions needed or taken ', ' Identify and document defects, functional and process inconstancies ', ' Conduct frequent internal quality control reviews and audits ', 'Supporting the Most Exciting and Meaningful Missions in the World ', 'Minimum of 5 years of experience in a quality related role is mandatory', 'Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent or (4) years of relevant experienceSix Sigma certification is preferable, must be able to obtain a Certified Quality Improvement Associate (CQIA) certification within six months of hire into the position.Minimum of 5 years of experience in a quality related role is mandatoryProven ability to use and interpret the applicable documents as described in the NBC Statement of WorkAttention to detail to successfully understand and evaluate trends, maintain detailed recordsStrong organizational skillsDemonstrate the ability to work independently and as a member of the team to effectively interact with personnel at all levels', ' Lead lean six sigma process evaluations ', 'Senior Quality Analyst', ' Lead team and provide SME input to set, verify, validate, improve work standards, standard operating positions (SOP’s) and other desktop procedures ', 'Demonstrate the ability to work independently and as a member of the team to effectively interact with personnel at all levels', 'Attention to detail to successfully understand and evaluate trends, maintain detailed records', 'Minimum Knowledge, Skills And Abilities', 'Strong organizational skills']

job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities', 'Qualifications', 'Assists with development, configuration, integration, enhancement, deployment, testing, support.', 'Involved with test plans, UAT, system/integration testing, data validation, defect triage and work arounds.', 'Guidewire v10.0, IAIABC, Workers Compensation & Commercial Lines preferred.', 'Participates in Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions, Joint Requirement Planning sessions (JRP), walkthroughs, interviews, daily stand ups, project meetings. etc.', 'Knowledge of coverages, policies, changes, renewals, premiums, billing, etc.', '5+ years as an Information Technology Business Analyst and/or IT Systems Analyst.', '4+ years with Guidewire PolicyCenter, ClaimCenter, and integrations.', '4+ years with Guidewire PolicyCenter, ClaimCenter, and integrations.2+ years of Guidewire Integration with vendor systems (technofunctional).5+ years as an Information Technology Business Analyst and/or IT Systems Analyst.6+ years of experience in the Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance Industry.Knowledge of coverages, policies, changes, renewals, premiums, billing, etc.Web Services, APIs, SOAPUI, XML, FTP/SFTP, Portal/UI/Engage, eSignature/Forms.Data Exchange, EDI, Data Mapping, Data Modeling, Databases, and/or Data Migration.SQL Server, Oracle/SQL queries, Data Validation, UAT, System/Integration testing.Guidewire v10.0, IAIABC, Workers Compensation & Commercial Lines preferred.Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field.Agile/Scrum, RAD, TDD, XP, Visio, Onbase, Rally and/or Jira preferred.', 'Collaborates with Vendors, Dev and QA, to clarify system capabilities and resolve issues.', 'Guidewire Business Analyst / Guidewire Systems Analyst - PolicyCenter / Integration ', 'Bachelor’s Degree or Master’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field.', 'Designs and reviews Software Requirement Specifications (SRS), Business Requirements Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications (FSD), Systems Design Specifications (SDS), and Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM).', 'Data Exchange, EDI, Data Mapping, Data Modeling, Databases, and/or Data Migration.', 'Provides direction regarding Guidewire software application implementation and integration projects. Assists with PolicyCenter integrations with vendor systems.Communicates with vendors/3rd parties. Uses knowledge of Data Exchange, EDI, Data Mapping, Data Modeling, Portals, Web Services, SOAPUI, APIs, FTP/SFTP, SQL, etc.Collaborates with business users and stakeholders and gathers business requirements.Analyzes and documents business needs, and translates them into technical requirements.Participates in Joint Application Development (JAD) sessions, Joint Requirement Planning sessions (JRP), walkthroughs, interviews, daily stand ups, project meetings. etc.Designs and reviews Software Requirement Specifications (SRS), Business Requirements Documents (BRD), Functional Specifications (FSD), Systems Design Specifications (SDS), and Requirement Traceability Matrix (RTM).Develops User stories, story cards, artifacts, workflows, Use Cases, UML diagrams, modeling, wireframes/mockups/prototypes, etc.Performs gap analysis, as-is/to-be analysis, feasibility analysis, and risk analysis.Documents project progress and velocity including burn down charts/burn up charts.Collaborates with Vendors, Dev and QA, to clarify system capabilities and resolve issues.Assists with development, configuration, integration, enhancement, deployment, testing, support.Involved with test plans, UAT, system/integration testing, data validation, defect triage and work arounds.', '(2+ Year Project - W-2, 1099, or Corp-to-Corp)', 'Collaborates with business users and stakeholders and gathers business requirements.', 'Analyzes and documents business needs, and translates them into technical requirements.', 'Provides direction regarding Guidewire software application implementation and integration projects. Assists with PolicyCenter integrations with vendor systems.', 'Web Services, APIs, SOAPUI, XML, FTP/SFTP, Portal/UI/Engage, eSignature/Forms.', '2+ years of Guidewire Integration with vendor systems (technofunctional).', 'Documents project progress and velocity including burn down charts/burn up charts.', 'Performs gap analysis, as-is/to-be analysis, feasibility analysis, and risk analysis.', 'SQL Server, Oracle/SQL queries, Data Validation, UAT, System/Integration testing.', 'Agile/Scrum, RAD, TDD, XP, Visio, Onbase, Rally and/or Jira preferred.', 'Communicates with vendors/3rd parties. Uses knowledge of Data Exchange, EDI, Data Mapping, Data Modeling, Portals, Web Services, SOAPUI, APIs, FTP/SFTP, SQL, etc.', '6+ years of experience in the Property & Casualty (P&C) Insurance Industry.', 'Develops User stories, story cards, artifacts, workflows, Use Cases, UML diagrams, modeling, wireframes/mockups/prototypes, etc.']

['', 'Responsibilities', 'Qualifications', 'Purpose', 'Familiarity with other clinical data standards including BRIDG, ODM and SHARE', 'Communication - Clearly communicates an understanding of clinical data standards concepts, clinical principles, and regulatory guidance and acts in accordance with those principles. Effectively presents data standards concepts and logical arguments to statistical programmers, statisticians, data scientists, clinical development and regulatory. Able to diplomatically and persuasively represent the interests of the Data Standards group in cross-functional initiatives.', 'About AbbVie', 'Expert level of knowledge of at least three areas of clinical data standards, and high level of knowledge in at least one additional area. Areas include CDASH, SDTM, ADaM, define.xml and controlled terminology.', 'Experience with metadata repository technology and its application in clinical data standards processes and experience with data standards governance', 'Industry Standards - Maintains complete and in-depth understanding of all CDISC guidance documents and implementation guides as well as FDA guidance and regulation regarding electronic submission of data. Keeps abreast of industry trends in data mapping, data management, standards compliance methodologies, metadata management and data warehousing.', 'Metadata Repository - Responsible for managing libraries of CDISC-related metadata, terminology and related standards within the metadata repository. Provides governance oversight to Data Standards Analyst and Sr Data Standards Analyst to ensure consistency in metadata.', "Ensure any unresolved issues are appropriately documented (for example in the FDA's Data Reviewer's Guides)", 'Job Level Code', 'Equal Employment Opportunity', " Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Polices and procedures Industry Standards - Maintains complete and in-depth understanding of all CDISC guidance documents and implementation guides as well as FDA guidance and regulation regarding electronic submission of data. Keeps abreast of industry trends in data mapping, data management, standards compliance methodologies, metadata management and data warehousing. eCRF Design - Demonstrates extensive understanding of CDASH and SDTM standards and concepts. Able to critically review eCRF designs to ensure compatibility/conformance with CDASH/SDTM standards. Recognizes limitations if eCRF design and correct flaws proactively. SDTM Conformance Mapping - Demonstrate extensive understanding of SDTM, Standard Terminology and common coding dictionaries. Reviews SDTM conformance mapping specifications and corrects flaws proactively. CDISC Validation Tools - Demonstrates knowledge of rules for SDTM and the associated define.xml file or rules for ADaM and the associated define.xml file and able to appropriately interpret results from common validation tools. Executes validation tools and collaborates with other functions to resolve identified issues. Ensure any unresolved issues are appropriately documented (for example in the FDA's Data Reviewer's Guides) Metadata Repository - Responsible for managing libraries of CDISC-related metadata, terminology and related standards within the metadata repository. Provides governance oversight to Data Standards Analyst and Sr Data Standards Analyst to ensure consistency in metadata. Policies & Procedures - Assist in the development of data standards policies, procedures and practices. Communication - Clearly communicates an understanding of clinical data standards concepts, clinical principles, and regulatory guidance and acts in accordance with those principles. Effectively presents data standards concepts and logical arguments to statistical programmers, statisticians, data scientists, clinical development and regulatory. Able to diplomatically and persuasively represent the interests of the Data Standards group in cross-functional initiatives. Training & Mentoring - Be compliant with training requirements. Effectively mentor peers, Sr Data Standards Analysts and Data Standards Analysts with regard to data standards and functional operations. Train new Data Standards Analysts on process and systems related to the management and implementation of data standards. CDISC involvement - Maintains external reputation of a clinical data standards expert. Ensures consolidated review comments from Data Standards group and Statistical Programming are provided for applicable CDISC standards released for public review. Submits at least one abstract per year for presentation at a CDISC Interchange. ", ' MS with 8 years of relevant clinical research experience or BS with 10 years of relevant clinical research experience Expert level of knowledge of at least three areas of clinical data standards, and high level of knowledge in at least one additional area. ['', 'create, collaborate on, manage, and maintain live intelligence products while producing machine understandable knowledge integral in the product creation process. We work hard for our customers and, as a result, they rave about us, providing a Net Promoter Score of 97, a rating unheard of in the software industry. Modus Operandi is positioned at an inflection point where we are looking for the right business development leader to help the company pivot from a revenue model based on services to a product/solutions centric revenue model deriving higher margins through product licensing / subscriptions. You will be responsible for creating revenue growth, focusing on new customer acquisition, including penetration of new markets. You will be supported by matrixed team members from our Programs organization for cultivating follow-on business from existing customers and from our Engineering Center of Excellence (ECoE) for sales engineering support.', 'You Will Love This Opportunity Because You', 'Requirements', 'at all levels', 'CAREER OPPORTUNITY Position: Business Development Manager (This position is available in Melbourne, FL) The Company and Opportunity: Modus Operandi is a high-tech software company serving the U.S. defense and intelligence community. Our passion is harnessing data and technology to empower smarter decisions with Movia, our flagship product. Movia provides living intelligence, helping organizations improve the quality and speed of their critical decisions. Our approach combines our advanced solutions that leverage next-generation semantic technologies, our team’s rare engineering and scientific expertise, and our rigorous and proven implementation methodology. Over the past 35 years, Modus Operandi has provided its customers with innovative solutions for data management, data correlation and fusion, workflow, human-computer interface, cognitive computing, contextual pattern recognition, and machine learning analytics. Our newest innovative solution combines these advances into our flagship software product Movia™. Movia delivers our customers smarter decisions by mapping decisions to data, transforming data to living intelligence and optimizing the collaboration of human analysts and machine analytics. Our defense customers include the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Army, U.S. Navy, U.S. Marine Corps, Missile Defense Agency, Defense Threat Reduction Agency, and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, to name a few. We are expanding our presence within each of these customers and adding new ones frequently. Modus Operandi helps our customers develop an intelligence product knowledge management environment to help analysts', 'Overview :', 'CAREER OPPORTUNITY Position: Business Development Manager (This position is available in Melbourne, FL) The Company and Opportunity: Modus Operandi is a high-tech software company serving the U.S. defense and intelligence community. Our passion is harnessing data and technology to empower smarter decisions with Movia, our flagship product. Movia provides living intelligence, helping organizations improve the quality and speed of their critical decisions. Our approach combines our advanced solutions that leverage next-generation semantic technologies, our team’s rare engineering and scientific expertise, and our rigorous and proven implementation methodology. Over the past 35 years, Modus Operandi has provided its customers with innovative solutions for data management, data correlation and fusion, workflow, human-computer interface, cognitive computing, contextual pattern recognition, and machine learning analytics. Our newest innovative solution combines these advances into our flagship software product Movia™. Movia delivers our customers smarter decisions by mapping decisions to data, transforming data to living intelligence and optimizing the collaboration of human analysts and machine analytics. Our defense customers include the U.S. Air Force, U.S. Army, U.S. Navy, U.S. Marine Corps, Missile Defense Agency, Defense Threat Reduction Agency, and the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency, to name a few. We are expanding our presence within each of these customers and adding new ones frequently. Modus Operandi helps our customers develop an intelligence product knowledge management environment to help analystsat all levelscreate, collaborate on, manage, and maintain live intelligence products while producing machine understandable knowledge integral in the product creation process. We work hard for our customers and, as a result, they rave about us, providing a Net Promoter Score of 97, a rating unheard of in the software industry. Modus Operandi is positioned at an inflection point where we are looking for the right business development leader to help the company pivot from a revenue model based on services to a product/solutions centric revenue model deriving higher margins through product licensing / subscriptions. You will be responsible for creating revenue growth, focusing on new customer acquisition, including penetration of new markets. You will be supported by matrixed team members from our Programs organization for cultivating follow-on business from existing customers and from our Engineering Center of Excellence (ECoE) for sales engineering support.']
